result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Charles Morrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:36 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Charles Morrison in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Christopher Charles Morrison. Includes 22CF391 (Branch II File) 22CF61, 22FO68 & 22FO69.  ADA Ballo recites joint agreement which includes plea on 22CF391, Branch II file as part of a Global Resolution.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1- Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent in 22CF61 & NC to Ct 1- Bail Jumping-Felony in 22CF391. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF61 & Ct 1 in 22CF391. On motion of the State without objection, Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF61 & Ct 2 in 22CF391.  Court also dismisses 22FO68 & 22FO69.

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF61

- Court Costs: $268.00   
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Converted to Civil Judgment. 

- 79 days county jail, credit for time served, concurrent on both convictions. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF391

- Court Costs: $268.00   
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Converted to Civil Judgment

- 79 days county jail, credit for time served, concurrent on both convictions.

8:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Michelle Brekken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Charles Morrison in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for Christopher Charles Morrison. Court reviews file. Atty Selmer states DE is aware of charges. Waive reading. Atty Selmer enters NG pleas to both charges. Speedy trial demand. Branch 1 file is set for JT on 8/2/22. Atty Selmer requests this matter stay before Branch 2. Court sets STC after JT occurs in Branch 1 file. Adjourned at 8:55 AM.  gll

Mirrors complaint. arc

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer not in court. Defendant Christopher Charles Morrison in court, in custody. Set for ARGN. Court reviews case. Court resets ARGN due to non appearance by Attorney. Adjourned 09:20 AM  Case recalled at 09:22 AM.  Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video. Court reviews case. Court notes there has not been a information filed. Atty Ballo states information will be filed as soon as possible. Court sets ARGN. Adjourned 09:26 AM
Arraignment scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Arraignment on July 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:17 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Charles Morrison in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for Christopher Charles Morrison. ADA Becker calls Officer Max Berger of Hudson PD to testify. S/T Officer Berger. Direct by ADA Becker. Officer identifies Defendant. Cross by Atty Selmer. Redirect by ADA Becker. Witness excused and released. ADA Becker requests Court take judicial notice of 22CF61; no objection by Atty Selmer. ADA Becker moves for bind over. Closing arguments. Court review evidence and testimony. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court notes DE has trial before Branch 3 on 8/12/22. Court sets Arraignment. Adjourned at 10:42 AM.  gll
Arraignment scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Arraignment on July 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.

to appear via Zoom for 7/5 PH. Filed by Atty Selmer. km
Per EFV on 7-5-2022: "Okay to Atty. Selmer to appear by Zoom'' JA will let him know. rg/km
Appointing Atty Selmer.  gll
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amanda W. or Residence. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:17 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow with Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Donna Burger with Intern Kaitlyn Dippolito, DF: Christopher Charles Morrison appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond.  Court notes DE owes additional Cash in case 22CF61. Intern Dippolito request PH to be heard within time limits. Court set PH. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Filed by DA's Office. km
